title: Write an Expression
prompt:
Arthur went to the local taqueria to buy lunch for his family. He can buy
two tacos for the price of one burrito, and the chalupa is $0.75 more
than a burrito. The cost of one burrito is b dollars.

Which expression represents the cost of 2 burritos, 8 tacos and 4 chalupas?
hint: Try to write each unknown in terms of one unknown, so you just have one equation with one variable.
feedback:
<math>
 <mtable columnalign='left'>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>Find out how much each item costs in terms of </mtext><mi>b</mi><mtext>:</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>1 burrito: </mtext><mi>b</mi>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>1 taco: </mtext><mfrac>
     <mi>b</mi>
     <mn>2</mn>
    </mfrac>
    
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>1 chalupa: </mtext><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>0.75</mn>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>Find out how much each item costs in terms of b:</mtext>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>2 burritos: </mtext><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>8 tacos: 8</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac>
     <mi>b</mi>
     <mn>2</mn>
    </mfrac>
    
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>4 chalupas: 4(</mtext><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>0.75</mn><mo stretchy='false'>)</mo>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mrow></mrow>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
  <mtr>
   <mtd>
    <mtext>Total cost: </mtext><mn>2</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mtext>8</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac>
     <mi>b</mi>
     <mn>2</mn>
    </mfrac>
    <mo>+</mo><mtext>4(</mtext><mi>b</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>0.75</mn><mo stretchy='false'>)</mo>
   </mtd>
  </mtr>
 </mtable>
 
</math>
